snippet: Federal judges rejected requests by the two former legislative leaders to exclude evidence and dismiss charges.
abstract: Federal judges rule against several challenges mounted by State Sen Dean G Skelos and State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver in their separate corruption cases; Skelos had sought hearing into whether government had leaked information to news media, and Silver had sought to bar evidence from trial and called for dismissal of charges against him.
lead_paragraph: Federal judges rejected requests by the two former legislative leaders to exclude evidence and dismiss charges.

headline.print_headline: Setbacks for Legislators in Corruption Cases
headline.main: Setbacks for Dean Skelos and Sheldon Silver in Corruption Cases
